alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 3:59AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McCurtain County through 500 AM CDT... At 359 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Towson to 11 miles east of Raymond Gary State Park. Movement was east northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Idabel, Broken Bow, Wright City, Valliant, Millerton, Garvin, Plunketville, Rufe, Smithville, Hochatown, Watson, Battiest, Pickens, Mount Herman, Sherwood, Holly Creek, Glover, Slim, Bethel and Oak Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
